H0.text: An ion is the atomic structure with the least amount of mass among the structures presented.

H1.text: A proton has the least amount of mass among the atomic structures.

H2.text: A neutron has the least amount of mass among the atomic structures.

H3.text: An electron has the least amount of mass among the atomic structures listed.

A4.text: Electrons have the lowest mass of any charged lepton (or electrically charged particle of any type)

A5.text: The ratio between the mass of a proton and that of an electron is about 1836
